etymology.description: Pictogram: a pig with penis, meaning “male pig”.
etymology.interpretation: Graphically shows a boar with an explicitly drawn phallus to mark maleness. Some traditional analyses misread the lower element as a foot; by contrast, 豖 depicts a castrated pig with the penis detached.

examples.chinese: 这头𢑓在圈里叫得很大声(這頭𢑓在圈裡叫得很大聲)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tóu xiá zài juàn lǐ jiào de hěn dàshēng.
examples.english: This boar is grunting loudly in the pen.

examples.chinese: 农民把𢑓和母猪分开养(農民把𢑓和母豬分開養)。
examples.pinyin: Nóngmín bǎ xiá hé mǔzhū fēnkāi yǎng.
examples.english: The farmer raises boars separately from sows.

examples.chinese: 古书中用𢑓指未阉割的公猪(古書中用𢑓指未閹割的公豬)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔshū zhōng yòng xiá zhǐ wèi yān gē de gōngzhū.
examples.english: In classical texts, 𢑓 refers to an uncastrated boar.
